page.title: 08Lodmoor
page.content: I like living near{Lodmoor.}Lodmoor is a very special place.It is an open moor,which is very wet in places.It is a nature reserve,now managed by the{ {Royal Society for the Protection of {Birds (R.S.P.B.)} On Lodmoor there are a vast majority of birds such as Kestrels, Herons, Mallard, Coot, Gulls, Blackbirds, Crows, Sparrows, Pheasants and pigeon There are three hides where you can sit and watch the birds. Boards in the hides report birds seen in the moor. On Lodmoor there are streams and pathways you can explore. You can find many creatures such as eels, flatfish, blennies, gobies, crabs, sea scorpion, sticklebacks, prawns, rats, mice, snakes, lizards and cows. Neil Henson
